Key Match Events: The United States’ winning streak at the T20 Cricket World Cup ended with a seven-wicket defeat to India.
India won the toss and chose to bowl first.
The U.S. set a target of 110 runs.
Arshdeep Singh dismissed Shayan Jahangir on the first ball of the game.
Arshdeep Singh took a second wicket five balls later.
Steven Taylor and Nitish Kumar put on a key 31-run partnership.
Corey Anderson and Nitish Kumar took the total to almost 100 runs.
Mohammed Siraj took an excellent catch to dismiss Nitish Kumar.
Arshdeep Singh was the player of the match with four wickets.
Saurabh Netravalkar dismissed Virat Kohli for a golden duck.
Saurabh Netravalkar also dismissed Rohit Sharma.
Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube had a 67-run partnership.
The U.S. was penalized five runs for failing to start the new over within a minute three times in an innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Nitish Kumar was the star with the bat for the U.S. with 27 runs from 23 balls.
Saurabh Netravalkar stood out with the ball, conceding just 18 runs across his four overs and taking the wickets of Kohli and Sharma.
Netravalkar's drop of Suryakumar Yadav was costly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The U.S. can still qualify for the Super Eights with a win or a rained-off game against Ireland.
Heavy rain is expected in Lauderhill, Florida, where the U.S. will play Ireland.
